intro: Centromadia pungens, commonly known as the stinging centromadia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that can release an irritant when touched, giving it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish in color. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
